name: bombazine
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a thick, usually black, material made from wool mixed with silk or cotton, used especially in the Victorian period for making mourning clothes (= dark clothes worn when someone has died): The children were all taught by one strict lady, dressed in bombazine from head to toe. The woman wore a thick black bombazine coat.
More examplesFewer examplesShe is dressed in severe fitted bombazine. Their beloved skirts of black bombazine they brought from home were ill suited to camp life.The two young women both wore deep mourning of crape and bombazine.The accompanying music conveys the period atmosphere more subtly than any bombazine and lace. How do you go ballistic in a bombazine gown and a mob-cap?
